text.div:
Example Organism Substance Triggers for Public Health Reporting

This example set of values contains organism and substance names that represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition regardless of the clinical presentation of the condition

Copyright Statement: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright@copy; 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

This value set includes codes from the following code systems:

  • Include these codes as defined in http://snomed.info/sct
    CodeDisplay
    1009003Salmonella Oakland (organism)
    10096007Salmonella Leoben (organism)
    10112007Salmonella Alamo (organism)
    10183008Salmonella Pensacola (organism)
    10248003Salmonella Travis (organism)

title: Example Organism Substance Triggers for Public Health Reporting
